All Classes

  • All Classes Interface Summary Class Summary Enum Summary 
    Class Description
    Animation
    An animation is a series of tiles displayed in a certain order, each tile taking up a specific amount of tile.
    AnimationFrame
    Used to store information regarding a single frame in an animation.
    AwtRenderer
    Used for drawing the game with described by the rendering commands, using the AWT graphics context.
    Debugger
    This class is used to print information within the classes in this project.
    DrawTileCommand
    This is a command to the graphics processor to draw a tile.
    Element
    This is an interface for an XML element.
    ElementList
    A list of XML elements.
    FillRectCommand
    This command is used to fill an area with color.
    Game
    This class implements all of the game logic.
    Game.Button
    Enumerates the buttons available to the game.
    GameApp
    This class contains the entry point of the game.
    GameRenderer
    This class is used to describe how the game should currently be renderer.
    GameUi
    This is a user interface of the game using Java's builtin AWT framework.
    GameView
    This class contains the window in which the game is rendered.
    IrregularTileLayer
    This class is a tile layer, part of a tile map, that has not yet been "normalized." Tile layers stored in the file are made up of "chunks", which are sections of a tile layer.
    KeyboardController
    This class is used to implement game controls using a standard keyboard from the main window's key listener.
    Matrix
    A simple integer matrix, used for referencing tiles.
    MouseController
    This class is used to relay mouse clicks from the user interface to the game (as button events.)
    Object
    This class contains object data that changes throughout game play.
    ObjectAction
    Contains information regarding a single action that an object can perform.
    ObjectTemplate
    Contains static information regarding an object.
    Polygon
    Represents a polygon with an arbitrary number of sides.
    Rect<T>
    Represents a simple 2D rectangle.
    RenderCommand
    A render command is the base of any rendering instruction that can be sent to the rendering pipeline.
    RenderCommandQueue
    This class contains all the commands issued to render a scene.
    RenderCommandVisitor  
    Tile
    Represents a single tile within a tile set.
    TileID
    This class contains helper methods for dealing with tile IDs.
    TileImageSet
    Used for storing scaled and rotated tile images.
    TileMap
    A tile map can be thought of as one "room" in the game.
    TileMapReader
    This class is used to load a tile map from the tile map editors data file.
    TileMapReader
    This class is used to load a tile map from the tile map editors data file.
    TileSet
    This class is made to contain the data from a .tsx file.
    TileSetReader
    This class is used for reading tile sets from the XML file created by Tiled.
    Vector
    A two dimensional vector.
    XmlElement
    An implementation of an XML element.
